Browse the source code of netbsd/external/lgpl3/mpfr/dist/src/exp2.c

1/* mpfr_exp2 -- power of 2 function 2^y
2
3Copyright 2001-2018 Free Software Foundation, Inc.
4Contributed by the AriC and Caramba projects, INRIA.
5
6This file is part of the GNU MPFR Library.
7
8The GNU MPFR Library is free software; you can redistribute it and/or modify
9it under the terms of the GNU Lesser General Public License as published by
10the Free Software Foundation; either version 3 of the License, or (at your
11option) any later version.
12
13The GNU MPFR Library is distributed in the hope that it will be useful, but
14WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of MERCHANTABILITY
15or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. See the GNU Lesser General Public
16License for more details.
17
18You should have received a copy of the GNU Lesser General Public License
19along with the GNU MPFR Library; see the file COPYING.LESSER. If not, see
20http://www.gnu.org/licenses/ or write to the Free Software Foundation, Inc.,
2151 Franklin St, Fifth Floor, Boston, MA 02110-1301, USA. */
22
23#define MPFR_NEED_LONGLONG_H
24#include "mpfr-impl.h"
25
26/* The computation of y = 2^z is done by *
27 * y = exp(z*log(2)). The result is exact iff z is an integer. */
28
29int
30mpfr_exp2 (mpfr_ptr y, mpfr_srcptr x, mpfr_rnd_t rnd_mode)
31{
32 int inexact, inex2;
33 long xint;
34 mpfr_t xfrac;
35 MPFR_SAVE_EXPO_DECL (expo);
36
37 MPFR_LOG_FUNC
38 (("x[%Pu]=%.*Rg rnd=%d", mpfr_get_prec(x), mpfr_log_prec, x, rnd_mode),
39 ("y[%Pu]=%.*Rg inexact=%d", mpfr_get_prec(y), mpfr_log_prec, y,
40 inexact));
41
42 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY (MPFR_IS_SINGULAR (x)))
43 {
44 if (MPFR_IS_NAN (x))
45 {
46 MPFR_SET_NAN (y);
47 MPFR_RET_NAN;
48 }
49 else if (MPFR_IS_INF (x))
50 {
51 if (MPFR_IS_POS (x))
52 MPFR_SET_INF (y);
53 else
54 MPFR_SET_ZERO (y);
55 MPFR_SET_POS (y);
56 MPFR_RET (0);
57 }
58 else /* 2^0 = 1 */
59 {
60 MPFR_ASSERTD (MPFR_IS_ZERO(x));
61 return mpfr_set_ui (y, 1, rnd_mode);
62 }
63 }
64
65 /* Since the smallest representable non-zero float is 1/2 * 2^emin,
66 if x <= emin - 2, the result is either 1/2 * 2^emin or 0.
67 Warning, for emin - 2 < x < emin - 1, we cannot conclude, since 2^x
68 might round to 2^(emin - 1) for rounding away or to nearest, and there
69 might be no underflow, since we consider underflow "after rounding". */
70
71 MPFR_STAT_STATIC_ASSERT (MPFR_EMIN_MIN >= LONG_MIN + 2);
72 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY (mpfr_cmp_si (x, __gmpfr_emin - 2) <= 0))
73 return mpfr_underflow (y, rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDN ? MPFR_RNDZ : rnd_mode, 1);
74
75 MPFR_STAT_STATIC_ASSERT (MPFR_EMAX_MAX <= LONG_MAX);
76 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY (mpfr_cmp_si (x, __gmpfr_emax) >= 0))
77 return mpfr_overflow (y, rnd_mode, 1);
78
79 /* We now know that emin - 2 < x < emax. Note that an underflow or
80 overflow is still possible (we have eliminated only easy cases). */
81
82 MPFR_SAVE_EXPO_MARK (expo);
83
84 /* 2^x = 1 + x*log(2) + O(x^2) for x near zero, and for |x| <= 1 we have
85 |2^x - 1| <= x < 2^EXP(x). If x > 0 we must round away from 0 (dir=1);
86 if x < 0 we must round toward 0 (dir=0). */
87 MPFR_SMALL_INPUT_AFTER_SAVE_EXPO (y, __gmpfr_one, - MPFR_GET_EXP (x), 0,
88 MPFR_IS_POS (x), rnd_mode, expo, {});
89
90 xint = mpfr_get_si (x, MPFR_RNDZ);
91 mpfr_init2 (xfrac, MPFR_PREC (x));
92 MPFR_DBGRES (inexact = mpfr_sub_si (xfrac, x, xint, MPFR_RNDN));
93 MPFR_ASSERTD (inexact == 0);
94
95 if (MPFR_IS_ZERO (xfrac))
96 {
97 /* Here, emin - 1 <= x <= emax - 1, so that an underflow or overflow
98 will not be possible. */
99 mpfr_set_ui (y, 1, MPFR_RNDN);
100 inexact = 0;
101 }
102 else
103 {
104 /* Declaration of the intermediary variable */
105 mpfr_t t;
106
107 /* Declaration of the size variable */
108 mpfr_prec_t Ny = MPFR_PREC(y); /* target precision */
109 mpfr_prec_t Nt; /* working precision */
110 mpfr_exp_t err; /* error */
111 MPFR_ZIV_DECL (loop);
112
113 /* compute the precision of intermediary variable */
114 /* the optimal number of bits : see algorithms.tex */
115 Nt = Ny + 5 + MPFR_INT_CEIL_LOG2 (Ny);
116
117 /* initialize of intermediary variable */
118 mpfr_init2 (t, Nt);
119
120 /* First computation */
121 MPFR_ZIV_INIT (loop, Nt);
122 for (;;)
123 {
124 /* compute exp(x*ln(2))*/
125 mpfr_const_log2 (t, MPFR_RNDU); /* ln(2) */
126 mpfr_mul (t, xfrac, t, MPFR_RNDU); /* xfrac * ln(2) */
127 err = Nt - (MPFR_GET_EXP (t) + 2); /* Estimate of the error */
128 mpfr_exp (t, t, MPFR_RNDN); /* exp(xfrac * ln(2)) */
129
130 if (MPFR_LIKELY (MPFR_CAN_ROUND (t, err, Ny, rnd_mode)))
131 break;
132
133 /* Actualisation of the precision */
134 MPFR_ZIV_NEXT (loop, Nt);
135 mpfr_set_prec (t, Nt);
136 }
137 MPFR_ZIV_FREE (loop);
138
139 inexact = mpfr_set (y, t, rnd_mode);
140
141 mpfr_clear (t);
142 }
143
144 mpfr_clear (xfrac);
145
146 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDN && xint == __gmpfr_emin - 1 &&
147 MPFR_GET_EXP (y) == 0 && mpfr_powerof2_raw (y)))
148 {
149 /* y was rounded down to 1/2 and the rounded value with an unbounded
150 exponent range would be 2^(emin-2), i.e. the midpoint between 0
151 and the smallest positive FP number. This is a double rounding
152 problem: we should not round to 0, but to (1/2) * 2^emin. */
153 MPFR_SET_EXP (y, __gmpfr_emin);
154 inexact = 1;
155 MPFR_SAVE_EXPO_UPDATE_FLAGS (expo, MPFR_FLAGS_UNDERFLOW);
156 }
157 else
158 {
159 MPFR_CLEAR_FLAGS ();
160 inex2 = mpfr_mul_2si (y, y, xint, rnd_mode);
161 if (inex2 != 0) /* underflow or overflow */
162 inexact = inex2;
163 MPFR_SAVE_EXPO_UPDATE_FLAGS (expo, __gmpfr_flags);
164 }
165
166 MPFR_SAVE_EXPO_FREE (expo);
167 return mpfr_check_range (y, inexact, rnd_mode);
168}
169
